result.markdown: --- title: "taylor 3.1.0" date: 2024-05-09 subtitle: "" description: "The chairman has cordially invited us to The Tortured Poets Department." image: "featured.jpg" twitter-card: image: "featured.jpg" open-graph: image: "featured.jpg" categories: - R - package - taylor - Taylor Swift engine: knitr --- I'm remarkably excited to announce the release of [taylor](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com) 3.1.0. taylor provides data on Taylor Swift's discography, including lyrics from [Genius](https://genius.com/artists/Taylor-swift) and song characteristics from [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06HL4z0CvFAxyc27GXpf02). You can install the updated version from CRAN with: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("taylor") ``` ::: This blog post will highlight the major changes in this release, including the addition of data from *THE TORTURED POETS DEPARTMENT*. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(taylor) ``` ::: ## Who uses typewriters, anyway? The primary update is the addition of data from *THE TORTURED POETS DEPARTMENT (TTPD)*. You can now find Spotify data and lyrics for all 31 songs in [`taylor_all_songs`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/taylor_songs.html). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) taylor_all_songs %>% filter(album_name == "THE TORTURED POETS DEPARTMENT") #> # A tibble: 31 × 29 #> album_name ep album_release track_number track_name artist featuring #> #> 1 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 1 Fortnight Taylo… Post Mal… #> 2 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 2 The Tortu… Taylo… #> 3 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 3 My Boy On… Taylo… #> 4 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 4 Down Bad Taylo… #> 5 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 5 So Long, … Taylo… #> 6 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 6 But Daddy… Taylo… #> 7 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 7 Fresh Out… Taylo… #> 8 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 8 Florida!!! Taylo… Florence… #> 9 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 9 Guilty As… Taylo… #> 10 THE TORTURED PO… FALSE 2024-04-19 10 Who's Afr… Taylo… #> # ℹ 21 more rows #> # ℹ 22 more variables: bonus_track , promotional_release , #> # single_release , track_release , danceability , #> # energy , key , loudness , mode , speechiness , #> # acousticness , instrumentalness , liveness , valence , #> # tempo , time_signature , duration_ms , explicit , #> # key_name , mode_name , key_mode , lyrics ``` ::: *TTPD* has also been added to [`taylor_albums`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/taylor_albums.html). However, Metacritic is currently undergoing some updates, and therefore user scores are currently disabled for albums. Thus, only the critic composite score is available for *1989 (Taylor's Version)* and *TTPD*. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taylor_albums #> # A tibble: 17 × 5 #> album_name ep album_release metacritic_score user_score #> #> 1 Taylor Swift FALSE 2006-10-24 67 8.4 #> 2 The Taylor Swift Holiday Col… TRUE 2007-10-14 NA NA #> 3 Beautiful Eyes TRUE 2008-07-15 NA NA #> 4 Fearless FALSE 2008-11-11 73 8.4 #> 5 Speak Now FALSE 2010-10-25 77 8.6 #> 6 Red FALSE 2012-10-22 77 8.6 #> 7 1989 FALSE 2014-10-27 76 8.3 #> 8 reputation FALSE 2017-11-10 71 8.3 #> 9 Lover FALSE 2019-08-23 79 8.4 #> 10 folklore FALSE 2020-07-24 88 9 #> 11 evermore FALSE 2020-12-11 85 8.9 #> 12 Fearless (Taylor's Version) FALSE 2021-04-09 82 8.9 #> 13 Red (Taylor's Version) FALSE 2021-11-12 91 8.9 #> 14 Midnights FALSE 2022-10-21 85 8.3 #> 15 Speak Now (Taylor's Version) FALSE 2023-07-07 81 9.2 #> 16 1989 (Taylor's Version) FALSE 2023-10-27 90 NA #> 17 THE TORTURED POETS DEPARTMENT FALSE 2024-04-19 76 NA ``` ::: Finally, a new color palette inspired by the *TTPD* aesthetic has been added to the [`album_palettes`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/album_palettes.html), and the [package website](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com) has been updated with a new theme and logo, also inspired by the album cover. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/fig-ttpd-palette-1.png){#fig-ttpd-palette fig-align='center' fig-alt='The five colors of the TTPD color palette. The hexadecimal codes are #1C160F, #3F3824, #635B3A, #ADA795, and #F7F4F0' width=576} ::: ::: This palette can be used inside any of the [`scale_*_taylor_*()`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/scale_taylor.html) functions. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} taylor_album_songs %>% filter(album_name == "THE TORTURED POETS DEPARTMENT", !is.na(energy)) %>% mutate(track_name = fct_inorder(track_name)) %>% ggplot(aes(x = energy, y = fct_rev(track_name))) + geom_col(aes(fill = track_name), show.legend = FALSE) + scale_fill_taylor_d(album = "THE TORTURED POETS DEPARTMENT") + labs(x = "Song Energy (From Spotify)", y = NULL) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/fig-ttpd-energy-1.png){#fig-ttpd-energy fig-align='center' fig-alt='A horizontal bar graph showing track names on the y-axis and song energey on the x-axis. Bars a filled with colors derived from the TTPD color palette, ranging from a light grey to black.' width=576} ::: ::: ## Minor Changes There were also a number of minor improvements: * Additional documentation has been added to better describe how to access lyrics in [`taylor_all_songs`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/taylor_songs.html) and [`taylor_album_songs`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/taylor_songs.html) (see [`vignette("lyrics")`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/articles/lyrics)). * Spotify audio features for "You're Losing Me (From The Vault)" have been added to [`taylor_all_songs`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/taylor_songs.html) and [`taylor_album_songs`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/taylor_songs.html). * Surprise songs data for the South American and Asia-Pacific legs of The Eras Tour have been added to [`eras_tour_surprise`](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/reference/eras_tour_surprise.html). For a complete list of changes, check out the [changelog](https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/news/index.html#taylor-310). ## Acknowledgments {.appendix} Featured photo by Katrin Hauf on Unsplash.
